systems.name: Dungeons & Dragons (D&D)
systems.description: The iconic fantasy TTRPG that popularized the genre, where players create heroes to explore dungeons, fight monsters, and embark on epic quests in a world filled with magic.

systems.name: Call of Cthulhu
systems.description: A horror TTRPG inspired by H.P. Lovecraft's works, where players investigate eldritch mysteries and confront cosmic horrors, often leading to tragic ends and loss of sanity (Sanity/d100 system).

systems.name: Pathfinder
systems.description: A fantasy TTRPG with a ruleset originally based on D&D 3.5 edition, featuring deep customization options, an extensive library of supplements, and its own rich fantasy setting.

systems.name: Blades in the Dark
systems.description: A game set in the haunted, industrial city of Doskvol. Players take on the roles of scoundrels and criminals, working together to complete daring 'scores' (heists) with flashback mechanics.

systems.name: Star Wars Roleplaying Game (Fantasy Flight/Edge)
systems.description: A series of TTRPGs set in the Star Wars universe, using a unique narrative dice system where results indicate success/failure as well as additional effects (e.g., threat or advantage).

systems.name: Vampire: The Masquerade
systems.description: A modern gothic TTRPG where players are vampires (Kindred) navigating the political schemes and dark secrets of their hidden society (The Masquerade) in a World of Darkness.

systems.name: Traveller
systems.description: A classic science fiction TTRPG known for its life-path character creation system and focus on space exploration, trade, combat, and surviving in a vast, sprawling galaxy.

systems.name: Monster of the Week
systems.description: A Powered by the Apocalypse (PbtA) game inspired by TV shows like 'Buffy the Vampire Slayer' and 'Supernatural.' Players are monster hunters investigating and facing supernatural threats.

systems.name: GURPS (Generic Universal RolePlaying System)
systems.description: A highly flexible, 'generic' system designed to be adapted to any setting or genre (fantasy, sci-fi, horror, etc.), known for its detailed character creation and 3d6 roll-under core mechanic.

systems.name: MÃ¶rk Borg
systems.description: A rules-light, dark, and brutally simple fantasy RPG known for its unique, visually striking graphic design and focus on desperate adventurers in a dying world.

adventureTypes.title: Mysterious & Atmospheric
adventureTypes.description: Focuses on building suspense, hinting at hidden secrets, and emphasizing the unknown. Emphasizes a sense of foreboding and intrigue.
adventureTypes.example: A haunted forest, ancient ruin shrouded in fog, a cryptic prophecy.
adventureTypes.suitable: Level 3-5, players who enjoy puzzles and uncovering secrets.

adventureTypes.title: Lighthearted & Humorous
adventureTypes.description: Emphasizes comedic situations, witty dialogue, and silly characters. Aims for enjoyment and laughs.
adventureTypes.example: A quest to retrieve stolen pies, rescuing a grumpy gnome from a mischievous sprite, dealing with inept monsters.
adventureTypes.suitable: Players who enjoy roleplaying comedic situations and lighthearted challenges. Works well at lower levels (1-3).

adventureTypes.title: Grim & Serious
adventureTypes.description: Focuses on dark themes, moral dilemmas, and significant consequences. Can be unsettling and challenging.
adventureTypes.example: A quest to defeat a tyrannical sorcerer, investigating a corrupeted temple, dealing with loss and betrayal.
adventureTypes.suitable: Players who enjoy challenging encounters and complex narratives. Works well with high-level play (5+).

adventureTypes.title: Epic & Heroic
adventureTypes.description: Focuses on grand quests, heroic deeds, and overcoming seemingly insurmountable obstacles. Emphasizes teamwork and sacrifice.
adventureTypes.example: A quest to retrieve a powerful artifact, defeat a monstrous horde, save a kingdom from destruction.
adventureTypes.suitable: Players who enjoy a sense of accomplishment and teamwork. Works well with higher-level play.

adventureTypes.title: Whimsical & Fantastical
adventureTypes.description: Embraces a sense of wonder, magic, and imaginative creatures. Often playful and light, event when facing challenges.
adventureTypes.example: Exploring a land made of candy, befriending mischievous pixes, navigationg a world dominated by dreams.
adventureTypes.suitable: Players who enjoy imaginative words and whimsical adventures. Works well for every level

adventureTypes.title: Mystery & intrigue
adventureTypes.description: Focuses on uncovering a secret, solving a puzzle, or unraveling a conspiracy. Emphasizes investigation and deduction.
adventureTypes.example: Finding a hidden treasure, solving a murder, uncovering a plot by villains.
adventureTypes.suitable: Players that enjoy puzzles and detective work. Works well at any level but particularly good for higher levels.

classicSettings.title: Medieval Kingdom
classicSettings.description: A typical medieval setting with castles, villages, knights, and political intrigue. Great for a traditional adventure feel. (Think Lord of the Rings)

classicSettings.title: Ancient Ruins
classicSettings.description: Explore the crumbling remains of a long-lost civilization. Could be riddled with traps, puzzles, and ancient magic. (Think Indiana Jones meets D&D)

classicSettings.title: Forest Realm
classicSettings.description: A vast and ancient forest, teeming with wildlife, hidden groves, and potentially dangerous creatures. Perfect for a quest focused on wilderness survival or a mystical journey. (Think The Witcher).

classicSettings.title: Coastal City
classicSettings.description: A thriving port city with bustling markets, seafaring adventures, and hidden smuggling operations. (Think Pirates of the Caribbean)

uniqueSettings.title: Underdark
uniqueSettings.description: A subterranean world of monstrous creatures, dark magic, and treacherous landscapes. A great setting for a challenging dungeon crawl. (Think Dungeons & Dragons 4th Edition Underdark)

uniqueSettings.title: Floating Islands
uniqueSettings.description: A world where islands float amidtst the clouds, connected by magical briudges or precarious pathways. Offers unique vertical exploration and visual possibilities. (Think Avatar: The Last Airbender)

uniqueSettings.title: Desert Oasis
uniqueSettings.description: A harsh desert environment with hidden oases, ancient ruins, and nomadic tribes. Perfect for a desert themed adventure. (Think Lawrence of Arabia)

uniqueSettings.title: Frozen Wasteland
uniqueSettings.description: A bleak and unforgiving landscape of ice, snow, and glaciers. Great for a survival-focused quest. (Think The Frozen Wilds)'

uniqueSettings.title: Steampunk City
uniqueSettings.description: A Victorial-inspired city fueled by clockwork mechanisms and steam-owered technology. Offers a unique blend of fantasy and industrial elements. (Think Dishonored)

uniqueSettings.title: Dreamscape
uniqueSettings.description: A surreal and ever-changing realm of dreams and nightmares. A great setting for whimsical adventures with a touch of horror. (Think Alice in Wonderland)

twistedSettings.title: Underwater City
twistedSettings.description: A civilization thriving beneath the waves, with its own unique culture, architecture, and dangers.

twistedSettings.title: Post-Apocalyptic
twistedSettings.description: A world ravaged by a cataclysmic event, with survivors struggling to rebuild in a desolate landscape.

twistedSettings.title: Celestial Realm
twistedSettings.description: A heavenly plance accessible only through divine intervention. Filled with gods, angels, and other celestial beings.
